conclusion: To determine the position of the particle at t = 8 s, we need to calculate the displacement of the particle during the time interval t = 0 s to t = 8 s by finding the area under the velocity-time (v-t) graph.
The area under the v-t graph represents the integral of velocity over time, which gives displacement.
The v-t graph is divided into distinct regions corresponding to different time intervals, consisting of triangular and rectangular shapes.
The graph can be broken into intervals for easier calculation of areas.
Interval 1 (t = 0 s to t = 1 s) forms a triangle with a base of 1 s and a height of 2 m/s.
The area of the triangle in Interval 1 is 1 m.
Interval 2 (t = 1 s to t = 3 s) forms a rectangle with a base of 2 s and a height of 2 m/s.
The area of the rectangle in Interval 2 is 4 m.
Interval 3 (t = 3 s to t = 4 s) forms a triangle with a base of 1 s and a height of 2 m/s.
The area of the triangle in Interval 3 is 1 m.
Interval 4 (t = 4 s to t = 6 s) forms a triangle below the x-axis with a base of 2 s and a height of -1 m/s.
The area of the triangle in Interval 4 is -1 m.
Interval 5 (t = 6 s to t = 8 s) forms a rectangle below the x-axis with a base of 2 s and a height of -1 m/s.
The area of the rectangle in Interval 5 is -2 m.
The total displacement is the sum of the areas: 1 + 4 + 1 - 1 - 2 = 3 m.
The particle starts at x = 5 m at t = 0.
The final position is the initial position plus the displacement: 5 + 3 = 8 m.
